Accounts Officer Job at Zamiva Transnational Services




        
    

        
        Zamiva Transnational Services is a full-fledged human capital development and management consultancy servicing company incorporated in August, 2021 with its corporate Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to ensuring quality value addition to our clients’ businesses spanning all sectors of the economy in the areas of HR consulting, outsourcing, talent acquisition, executive search, employee/reference background verification, payroll management, learning & development, renting, catering and janitorial services, etc., leveraging research, technology, a highly skilled and passionate human capital base, and our core values of Collaboration, Leadership, Integrity, Continuous Improvement, High Performance and Expertise.
     

            
    



We are seasoned human resources professionals and management strategists with enviable corporate exposure and experience spanning various sectors of the economy, including banking, logistics & courier, engineering, manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, food & beverages, oil & gas, telecommunication, private security services, hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	Computer Skills needed.

N100,000 Monthly.

Project Manager Job at Spacefinish




        
    

        
        Spacefinish is one of Africa’s leading Design/Build company that specialises in office spaces. We have a core team of 20 professionals, and network of +40 consultant partners across multiple African countries.

At Spacefinish we do not see ourselves as just Project Managers and Designers, rather we see ourselves as influencers of work culture and brand identity for our clients. Our clients have undergone huge “internal” brand transformation as a result of the spaces we have delivered to them. We have gathered data that shows that our human centered approach to workspace design and construction has positively changed employee behavior.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Project Manager
Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Project Manager is responsible for the planning and supervising of a wide range of construction projects from start to finish.
	He/she will organise and oversee construction procedures and ensure they are completed in a timely and efficient manner.
	An excellent Project Manager must be well-versed in all construction methodologies and procedures and able to coordinate a team of professionals of different disciplines to achieve the best results.
	The goal will be to ensure all projects are delivered on time according to requirements and without exceeding budget.
	They coordinate with all teams working on the project to ensure that goals are met on time and that each team’s deliverables are compatible with all others, and they oversee a staff of supervisors and managers to aid them in this goal.
	When necessary, they work overtime and may need to hire new staff.


Principal Duties / Responsibilities


	Working with clients to detail specific project deliverables
	Creating a timeline of goals to be met
	Developing project plans for clients and staff
	Delegating project tasks to teams best suited to complete them
	Tracking project performance and analyzing deliverables against requirements
	Ensuring that all budgetary objectives are met, making adjustments as needed
	Overseeing junior staff and teams to ensure that work continues on budget and schedule


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Building Technology or Architecture from a recognized tertiary institution.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in Project Management role within the construction industry


Skills And Competency Requirements:


	A detail-oriented individual with a preferred background in architecture (if this is not possible, then a background in Civil engineering is the second choice)
	They should have the ability to understand architectural, structural and MEP drawings.
	Understanding of all google suite and MS office functions.
	Most candidates would tend to have experience in general exterior construction. So a candidate that has experience with interior fit-outs is a plus.
	The candidate has to understand Project Supervision and Coordination (Manage operations, understand the sequencing of tasks to ensure timely and quality delivery of project outcomes) and Stakeholder management.
	They should understand Program Of Works and critical path
	Great communication is key as the candidate would have to engage different stakeholders ranging from - Clients who would visit the site, artisans who will be working on-site, and the Spacefinish technical and management teams
	Good writing ability. The candidate would be expected to write reports
	Project confidence when speaking, as is a skill needed to influence across various stakeholder levels.
	They should have worked in mid to large-size construction companies in the past, where they had to manage more than 2 projects at any given time, and multiple vendors under them.
	High degree of familiarity with contract and subcontract documents, terms and conditions.
	Strong leadership and management skills
	Strong verbal and written communication skills
	Possess a strong HSE and Quality focus
	Must be detail oriented.

Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) Job at ONE




        
    

        
        ONE is a global, nonpartisan organization fighting for a more just world by demanding the investments needed to create economic opportunities and healthier lives in Africa. We do this by deploying trusted and dynamic advocacy that leverages hard-hitting data, credible grassroots activism, creative political engagement, and strategic partnerships. We use all this to influence decision-makers to take action and tackle the world’s biggest challenges.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) - Africa

Job Location: Abuja

About the Opportunity
     

            
    




	ONE is seeking a Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) to own and drive  HR and Recruiting support in a consultative and strategic manner for ONE’s operations in Africa.
	The Africa HRBP will be responsible for providing expert advice, as well as strategic and tactical support and implementation of Global HR initiatives, particularly for ONE staff based in Africa.
	He/she will work with the HR Director and Chief People Officer to develop and direct the implementation of human resources policies, plans and programs across Africa and also take a role in global programs. 
	This position will be based in Abuja, and will report to the HR Director and have a dotted reporting line to the Africa Executive Director.


Duties
In this role, you will:


	Provide HR services to include global human resources programs and policies, often encompassing several areas of human resources, including but not limited to organizational development, employee relations, recruiting, compensation, benefits, performance management, training, safety and research.
	Collaborate with senior and executive management within ONE Africa to strategically align organizational design and structure to ONE’s mission, vision and goals.
	Proactively identity opportunities and strategies to advance employee engagement, retention and morale improvement.
	Consult with employees and management on employee relations issues providing guidance and assistance with policy interpretation, understanding of country-specific employment law, open and direct communication, conflict resolution, performance management and conduct related issues.
	Establishes a strong rapport with team and managers in order to understand their strategic hiring needs, priorities, and constraints; to help the organization function and deliver optimally. Proactively communicate and report on HR matters in a data driven manner.
	Implements best practice and processes to manage the talent acquisition lifecycle: selection, interviewing, pre-employment background checks and references, employment offers and ensures that recruiting and hiring practices comply with organizational policies and country-specific laws.
	Recommends recruiting sources, creative and alternative advertising venues and strategies; tracks and reports on effectiveness.
	Provide support and back up on broader and strategic HR initiatives across Africa, working with the Africa Executive Director, HR, and other relevant leaders and managers.
	Serve as a member of the HR team. Provide input to or define short and long-term goals and objectives for HR delivery.
	Ensure efficient processing of HR administration across ONE’s Africa offices.
	Organize, facilitate and or deliver regional, market-based training as required.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources Management, Business, or related discipline and 8 years human resources experience or; Master’s Level degree and 5-8 years’ of directly related experience
	Significant experience supporting staff on a range of HR issues with a focus on employee relations, talent management and organizational development
	Demonstrated ability to successfully influence and communicate with all levels from employees to senior management.
	Membership of a HR professional organization is strongly preferred
	Experience of researching and interpreting labor law and regulatory issues in South Africa and Nigeria is required; experience in other sub-Saharan African countries is strongly encouraged.
	Demonstrated skills in the areas of: problem solving, systems thinking, diplomacy, conflict resolution and influencing skills.
	Demonstrated success in managing negotiations and handling people in difficult circumstances; demonstrable experience in employee mediation and arbitration would be a plus in this role.
	High level of computer literacy with expert proficiency with Excel and experience of using and proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint
	Commitment to the goals of the organization
	Demonstrable commitment to equal opportunities
	Very well organized, with the ability to multitask and with exceptional attention to detail
	Strong verbal and written communications skills including the ability to analyses and convey complex information in a simple manner to varied audiences
	Proven ability to think strategically, creatively, critically, and independently and to achieve results
	Proven interpersonal skills and a strong sense of teamwork and collaboration
	Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a matrix organization, balancing HR approaches with the realities of the business.
	Willingness to travel locally, regionally and internationally as needed.
	Demonstrated success working in a highly collaborative, global environment
	Cultural sensitivity, gravitas and respect, but also a great sense of humor.
	Knowledge of strategic business transitions and change management is preferred
	Experience of working in a similar capacity for an international or NGO organization is preferred
	Interest in international development and Africa is desirable 


Language Skills:


	Fluency in English required.  Fluency in French is a distinct advantage.


Travel:


	Occasional domestic travel (5-10%) may be required. Additional international and/or domestic travel opportunities may occur.


Compensation


	USD35,000 – USD45,000 / Annum
	This salary range is based on compensation survey data for similar organizations 


and is used to set pay internally at ONE. Where a new hire’s salary falls within this
range is based on a variety of factors, including the budget available for this
position.

Note: Due to the number of inquiries that ONE receives, we thank all candidates for their interest yet only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Compliance Operations Lead",
  "description": "Paystack is a technology company solving payments problems for ambitious businesses. Paystack&#39;s mission is to help merchants in Africa get paid by anyone, anywhere in the world. Over 9,000 of some of the best businesses in Nigeria use Paystack&rsquo;s modern payments gateway, including MTN, Taxify, Domino&rsquo;s Pizza, Smile Communications, Opera, God is Good Motors, Axa Mansard Insurance, and many others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Compliance Operations Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

About the Role


	Paystack is seeking an innovative and forward-thinking Compliance Operations Lead&nbsp;to join our Risk and Compliance team.
	In this role, you will manage and optimize the daily operations of our operational compliance teams (incl. disputes, fraud, reviews), which play a crucial role in supporting in-house programs such as AML/KYC/CFT compliance, financial crime compliance, and card network compliance.
	The team&rsquo;s primary focus is mitigating fraud, anti-money laundering, and card network compliance risks.
	As the Compliance Operations Lead, you will oversee the implementation, and maintenance of operational processes and controls, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements across partner organizations and jurisdictions.
	You&rsquo;ll bring a strong background in compliance operations, a sharp focus on operational efficiency, and a collaborative mindset to work closely with cross-functional teams and achieve compliance objectives.
	This role reports to the Head of Risk &amp; Compliance at Paystack and is based in one of our operating markets: Nigeria, Ghana, South Africa, or Kenya.


What you&#39;ll be doing
Financial Crimes Operations Management:


	??Lead the execution of AML transaction monitoring, disputes and fraud management processes to identify, investigate, and report suspicious activities.
	Optimize compliance systems to meet regulatory standards and improve efficiency in detecting and addressing risks.
	Develop and enhance fraud management strategies, balancing risk reduction with a seamless customer experience.
	Manage complex fraud investigations, coordinate with law enforcement when needed, and oversee transaction disputes to ensure timely, compliant resolutions.


Customer Due Diligence:


	Oversee customer onboarding, due diligence, and periodic reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory and policy requirements.
	Ensure KYC documents and data are thoroughly validated to meet compliance standards.


Card Network Compliance Management:


	Lead compliance efforts with major card networks, ensuring alignment with standards from Visa, MasterCard, and others.

	The team’s primary focus is mitigating fraud, anti-money laundering, and card network compliance risks.
	As the Compliance Operations Lead, you will oversee the implementation, and maintenance of operational processes and controls, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements across partner organizations and jurisdictions.
	You’ll bring a strong background in compliance operations, a sharp focus on operational efficiency, and a collaborative mindset to work closely with cross-functional teams and achieve compliance objectives.
	This role reports to the Head of Risk & Compliance at Paystack and is based in one of our operating markets: Nigeria, Ghana, South Africa, or Kenya.
